result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bruce Lee Larkin was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 67 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Brookfield Police Department.  Costs to be paid as a condition of extended probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Disclose to any physician in writing your extended supervision conditions.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant Bruce Lee Larkin in court, in custody, with attorney Victor E Plantinga.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Plantinga makes statements.  Defendant's girlfriend makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

8 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 67 days )
4 Years of Initial Confinement
4 Years of Extended Supervision
Conditions of extended supervision:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
Disclose to any physician in writing your extended supervision conditions. 
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
FINE or COSTS:  $3210.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Brookfield Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
AODA Assessment and follow through
Defendant Is eligible for the substance abuse program

Case called for a motion to suppress and a motion regarding the prior record.  Defendant Bruce Lee Larkin in court with attorney Victor E Plantinga.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the motion to suppress first.  State calls Officer Christopher Foster sworn in, testified. Defense calls witness Attorney Susan Hanson, sworn in, testified.  Testimony closed.  Parties give closing argument regarding the motion to suppress.  Court denies the motion to suppress.  Court takes up the matter of the prior convictions.  Court denies this motion.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
